comments:
When I was searching (file search) I got an error message
saying an SWT error had occured and I should close the application. 

I closed, and when I try to startup again I now keep getting the error
widget is disposed.  It seems there was some inconsistent state
left in the workspace, because when I remove the workspace I can
startup with no problem.

I don't have the log file from the original error any more, but here is
the stack trace that prevents startup.  This is on FreeBSD with
Eclipse 3.0 compiled from source based on the Linux source, with
minor modifications in the native part to make it compile (mostly changes
of paths in the Makefiles).  JRE is SUN JDK 1.4.2, also compiled from
source (FreeBSD port).

-----------------------------------------

What eclipse build are you using?

I used Eclipse 3.0 compiled from source, i.e. the final release. That would be
eclipse-sourceBuild-srcIncluded-3.0.zip.  I don't know what build that
corresponds to.

Can you please elaborate on "minor modifications in the native part" and give 
information about what version of GTK+ you are running on your FreeBSD machine.

Well, "modifications" might not be the best term.  I patched it to get it to
compile, e.g. added #includes.  I'm uploading the complete diff here.

hunter[35]$ pkg-config --modversion gtk+-2.0
2.4.0
hunter[36]$

Let me add that this version is otherwise very stable on my system.  My colleagues
on Linux complain about crashes every couple hours, for me it runs w/o any
incident many days, and only very rarely gets minor hickups.  Thanks for a great
product.

Created an attachment (id=14280)
my patches to get the native part to compile on FreeBSD

Pls note that this is for compiling a FreeBSD version, despite the fact that
I patch the linux tree.  I was too lazy to clone the tree first.

Georg, the workspace that fails around ? Could you be able to share it (zip it 
and attach it in this PR) ? I hope the workspace it not very large (<5Mb).

I meant to say:
Georg, do you still have the workspace that fails around ?
sorry I don't have the workspace any more.

I checked the code and there is nothing wrong with it and I can't reproduce 
this problem.
Therefore, I'm closing this as worksforme. Please reopen this bug if you have 
more information or a workspace which could help me to reproduce this problem.
